page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: The main road from Colchester to Cam- bridge ran straight through Abington. A thousand cars per hour and a lorry crashing into the school playground led to the construction of a bypass. Abington is now a peaceful village, to bike to school or the shops. Walking is also common in the village and there are many walks through the surr- ounding fields. There is a daily school bus for children living in the area to Gt.Abington primary school and Linton Village College. The villagers are served by a bus service connecting Cambridge & Haverhill. We conducted a survey and found that people have l.5 cars per family and 3.2 bicycles. The old railway ran from Cambridge to Haverhill. It ran through Abington. It was opened in 1865 and closed in 1967. Pampisford station was the nearest station, just outside Abington.
